First month with the new 15-inch Macbook Pro (2016)

February 26, 2017

Itâ€™s been almost a month since I bought my new Macbook Pro. So far, Iâ€™m liking it, though I do have few small issues with it.

Specs: 2.9 GHz i7 processor, 16GB RAM, 4GB video card, 1TB hard drive.

Like

  • TouchId is fast and secure. Works like magic.
  • Display is noticeably brighter and has richer color spectrum.
  • Keyboard is loud but I love the sound. Much more clicky and feels like it has better feedback.
  • Trackpad comes in handy when I do a lot of gestures across the screen like taking screenshots or dragging paths in Sketch.
  • In addition, I think Space Gray looks great and I love that the machine is lighter too.

Dislike

  • Performance doesnâ€™t appear significantly better in comparison with the old Macbook Pro. While some things such as boot time are faster, the machine doesnâ€™t feel any faster than my previous Macbook that has almost the same specs.
  • Gets hot. Iâ€™m a procrastinator and at any given time I have anywhere from 40-âˆž tabs open depending on how many projects I work on simultaneously. My old Macbook would rarely get hot to the point where Iâ€™d feel it with my hands, but the new Macbook gets there faster. Right now I have around 50 tabs open and itâ€™s already warm. I havenâ€™t even opened Sketch yet.
  • Touch bar takes time to get used to. Some controls will seem unintuitive at first but youâ€™ll be alright after a while. Eventually it enables you to do more than a regular keyboard, but the price you pay is the time it takes to get used to the new features.

That being said, I donâ€™t use ports much so I didnâ€™t really feel any discomfort in that area.All I need is an SD card to USBâ€“C and a USB 3 to USBâ€“C dongles which are pretty easy to get. Will update this post if I notice anything weird.

This Macbook definitely feels like an improvement, but itâ€™s not pushing the boundaries like it used to.
